item.name: Department of Health and Human Services
Drug safety, medical device, and laboratory regulation

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: Traditional Cigar Manufacturing and Small Business Jobs Preservation Act of 2017
Traditional Cigar Manufacturing and Small Business Jobs Preservation Act of 2017

To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to clarify the Food and Drug Administration's jurisdiction over certain tobacco products, and to protect jobs and small businesses involved in the sale, manufacturing and distribution of traditional and premium cigars.
Traditional Cigar Manufacturing and Small Business Jobs Preservation Act of 2017

bill.title: Traditional Cigar Manufacturing and Small Business Jobs Preservation Act of 2017

item.text:
Traditional Cigar Manufacturing and Small Business Jobs Preservation Act of 2017

This bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to exempt traditional large and premium cigars from regulation by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and from user fees assessed on tobacco products by the FDA.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. POSEY:H.R. 564.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 1Article 1, Section 8, Clause 3Article 1, Section 8, Clause 18[Page H548]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
